result.execSummary:
The defendant Waukon W Blackdeer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with Dawn C. or Jeffery V.
Defendant may apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation.

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Waukon W Blackdeer
Current: W9952 State Hwy 54, Black River Falls, WI 54615-5429 United States  (Effective: 06-28-2015)
Prior: N417 Clark Ave, Neillsville, WI 54456

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Court read the victim impact statement.  It appears to the court that the victim is requesting restitution.  There is no restitution information in the file.  ADA advised the court that the victim did not return any information regarding restitution and that they have complied with their obligations regarding victim notification.   Defendant plead guilty to counts 2 and 3.  Counts 1, 4, 5, and 6 dismissed and read in.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitution rights waived and elements with the defendant.  He understood.  Defense stipulates as to a factual basis.  Court finds that the defendant entered his plea, and waived his constitutional rights freely, knowingly and intelligently.  Factual basis exists.  Find guilty as plead to.  Joint recommendation for 2 years probation.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact with the victim Dawn C.  $100.00 restitution, plus surcharges.   Attorney Fredrickson also requests that if the defendant successfully completes probation that the defendant may apply for expungement.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court orders sentence withheld, 2 years probation.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact with Dawn C.  or Jeffery V.   Pay restitution of $100.00, plus surcharge.  Whom payable to, to be determined.  AODA.  Subject to random testing.  If defendant successfully completes probation the defendant may apply for expungement.  CC
ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Parties have an agreement.  Set for plea/sentencing on 3/30/15 at 1:30 pm

Pre-trial conference at 02-11-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 03-02-2015 03:00 pm.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Reading of complaint waived.  Time limit for preliminary hearing waived.  PTC & STC requested by defense.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared without counsel.  Defendant needs to apply for SPD representation.
No Alcohol.  Not to be where alcohol is sold/served.  No contact with Jeffrey V or Dawn C. or anyone else at their residence.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:  Jeffrey V. or Dawn C., or anyone else at their residence.
DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail, without counsel.
ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, without counsel.  Defendant to apply for SPD representation.
